intro: Orellana orellana, commonly known as the golden vine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its long, trailing stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. Orellana orellana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
